events.title: Launch of the First Passenger Railway Chartered in Britain
events.description: The Liverpool and Manchester Railway, which was the first railway to rely exclusively on steam power, was officially opened. It marked the beginning of the railway age in Britain.
events.significance: This event revolutionized transport, commerce, and the Industrial Revolution, enabling faster movement of goods and people.

events.title: Battle of Flers-Courcelette Begins
events.description: Part of the larger Battle of the Somme in World War I, this battle was notable for the first use of tanks in warfare by the British forces.
events.significance: The introduction of tanks marked a turning point in military technology and modern warfare tactics.

events.title: The Blitz Begins on London
events.description: The German Luftwaffe launched an intense bombing campaign on London and other British cities during World War II.
events.significance: Marked a critical phase in the Battle of Britain, demonstrating the devastating effects of aerial bombing on civilian populations.

events.title: Martin Luther King Jr. Writes 'Letter from Birmingham Jail'
events.description: While imprisoned, King penned this influential letter defending nonviolent resistance to racism.
events.significance: The letter became a foundational text for the American civil rights movement, articulating moral and strategic arguments against segregation and injustice.

events.title: Membership of Hong Kong Transferred to China Announced
events.description: The official transfer of sovereignty over Hong Kong from Britain to China was scheduled for July 1, 1997, with preparations and negotiations culminating around this time.
events.significance: Marked the end of British colonial rule in Hong Kong and the beginning of Chinese administration under the 'one country, two systems' framework.
